title: Work done to stop a wheel

content.prompt: A wheel with rotational inertia 0.04 kg•m2 and radius 0.02 m is turning at the rate of 10 revolutions per second when a frictional torque is applied to stop it. How much work is done by the torque in stopping the wheel?

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
